programme.title: How Do They Do It S13 - "Tesla/Horse Hair Fabrics/Pool Cleaners"
programme.desc: How do they build the world’s fastest electric car? How do they turn horses’ tails into fine fabrics? How do they clean the world’s largest swimming pools?

programme.title: How Do They Do It S13 - "Snails/Cutlery/Fishing Kayaks"
programme.desc: How do they feed France’s appetite for snails? How do they turn slabs of steel into shiny cutlery? How do they craft a kayak you can paddle with your feet?

programme.title: How Do They Do It S13 - "Emergency Bridges/Marker Pens/Electric superbike"
programme.desc: How do they build emergency bridges that can take the weight of a tank? How do they make a marker pen that never fades? How do they design a 200 mph superbike?

programme.title: How Do They Do It S13 - "Crystal Glass/Flat Screen TVs/Deepest Pool/Ketchup"
programme.desc: How do they blow the world’s finest crystal wine glasses? How do they make the world’s slimmest TVs? How do they heat the world’s deepest swimming pool? How do they fill a million bottles a day of the world’s favourite ketchup?

programme.title: How Do They Do It S13 - "Pulverizer/Bomber Jackets/Lambic Beer/"
programme.desc: How do they forge a set of jaws that can chomp through concrete and demolish tower blocks? How do they stitch the historic airman’s bomber? How do they brew the oldest beer in the Western World?

programme.title: How Do They Do It S13 - "Sydney Opera House/Handsaws/Microphones/Icebreaker"
programme.desc: How do they cool Sydney’s famous Opera House? How do they turn Sheffield steel into a carpenter’s handsaw? How do they make a microphone that can pick up a whisper? How do they steer a safe course through a frozen river?

programme.title: How Do They Do It S13 - "Moonshine/e-bikes/Wetsuits"
programme.desc: How do they brew moonshine in the heart of New York City? How do they make a battery powered bicycle that can do nearly 30mph? How do they grow the rubber for wetsuits in the Arizona desert?

programme.title: How Do They Do It S13 - "Gemstones/Cowboy Boots/Road Sweepers"
programme.desc: How do they mine one of the rarest gemstones in the world? How do they craft the classic cowboy boot? How do they build a monster road sweeper that can pick up 7 tonnes of trash?

programme.title: How Do They Do It S13 - "Duvets/Drill Pipes/Rubber Bands"
programme.desc: How do they make the world’s softest duvets? How do they drill for oil thousands of metres below ground? How do they put the stretch in the world’s stretchiest rubber bands?

programme.title: How Do They Do It S13 - "Aircraft Engines/Fisherman’s Friend/Plastic Bank Notes/Ice Cream"
programme.sub-title: Aircraft Engines/Fisherman’s Friend/Plastic Bank Notes/Ice Cream
programme.desc: How do they build a diesel engine that can fly? How do they make the cough sweet that's been keeping throats clear for 150 years? How do they turn clear plastic into unforgeable bank notes? How do they do the world’s favourite ice cream flavours?

programme.title: How Do They Do It S13 - "Armored Car/Christmas Trees/Cymbals"
programme.desc: How do they turn a family car into a fortress on wheels? How do they grow millions of perfect Christmas Trees? How do they hammer out the world’s best cymbals?

programme.title: The Demolition Man S1 - "Belgium"
programme.desc: In this episode a 170 meter tower is imploded! The structure is close to a public highway so there’s an extra element of concern for local safety.

programme.title: The Demolition Man S1 - "The Best of Part 1"
programme.desc: Brendan Moar is here to uncover the people and machinery behind the worlds most dangerous and captivating demolitions.

programme.title: Engineering the Future S2 - "The Metaverse"
programme.desc: This episode is different, it's about an idea, the Metaverse. The Metaverse is the successor to the internet. It will change the lives of almost every human on the planet.

programme.title: Engineering the Future S2 - "Hyperloop"
programme.desc: Virgin Hyperloop is a train that runs inside a steel tunnel. This revolutionary new vehicle floats along the track using magnetic levitation and glides at airline speeds.

programme.title: Engineering the Future S2 - "The Race to Space"
programme.desc: A new era of space, where small satellites no bigger than a showbox will be deployed not in one or twos, but in their thousands, referred to as satellite swarms.

programme.title: The Lightbulb Moment S1 - "LIKE BUTTON"
programme.desc: When first presented with the like button Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg had a simple response: “No.” He worried that it would discourage more meaningful online interaction. Eventually, his team changed his mind and transformed the world.

programme.title: The Lightbulb Moment S1 - "CUBICLE"
programme.desc: A futuristic designer, Robert Propst, dreamed up “The Action Office” as a workplace utopia that would unleash the modern knowledge worker’s vast untapped potential.

programme.title: The Lightbulb Moment S1 - "BARCODE"
programme.desc: Barcodes have radically changed global commerce, helping fuel the rise of everything from massive companies like Walmart to world powers like China. And it all started with a man daydreaming on a beach in 1949.

programme.title: The Lightbulb Moment S1 - "FLORIDA"
programme.desc: Florida wasn’t always the Sunshine State. In the 1920s, an army of real estate boosters set out to redefine Florida from an economic backwater to a vacation destination, sparking a land boom–and bust–the likes of which America had never seen before.

programme.title: Unearth S1 - "Nuclear 2.0"
programme.desc: To mitigate this climate emergency, we must use all of the tools at our disposal, like the Nuclear Energy. This documentary looks at the new safer nuclear technology and how it could be utilised in a coal burning country like Australia.

programme.title: Unearth S1 - "100 Million Year Old Secrets Revealed"
programme.desc: We look at a newly discovered and oldest existing mammal tail preserved in Amber and being studied by scientists.

programme.title: Space Dealers S1 - "Dealers on a Mission"
programme.desc: Larry takes on an impossible mission: he’s been asked to find an item worn in space by Apollo 15 legend Al Worden. Torie searches for Russian space items for a museum in San Francisco and Cole goes on the hunt for an item from Apollo 13.

programme.title: Space Dealers S1 - "Money Trouble"
programme.desc: Larry gets the offer of a lifetime: a Soviet era space suit. Torie pays big for an Apollo 11 artefact but it’s not what it seems. Cole meets Apollo 7 legend Walt Cunningham.

programme.title: Space Dealers S1 - "The Apollo Sale"
programme.desc: Torie’s son Jason joins her on the road. Larry turns ‘gastronaut’ when he comes across some space food; and a collector’s flash sale sees Cole bid for an Apollo 11 item with an incredible story.

programme.title: Space Dealers S1 - "Good Luck, Bad Luck"
programme.desc: Cole gets lucky when he finds a Russian space suit in an old box, but the gloves are missing. To find the gloves he has to strike a deal with Larry. Torie hears how Coke and Pepsi joined the space race and meets former NASA astronaut Winston Scott.

programme.title: The Great Penguin Rescue S1 - "Episode 1"
programme.desc: Michaela Strachan takes things to the next level as she signs up as a volunteer on Africa's biggest penguin rescue mission. Will Michaela be able to cope and takes on the care of hundreds of abandoned penguin chicks at the SANCCOB sea bird hospital?

programme.title: The Great Penguin Rescue S1 - "Episode 2"
programme.desc: Michaela is reaching the end of her training at the SANCCOB sea bird hospital with the angry oiled adult penguins, but just as she feels she is getting the hang of things the abandoned chicks start piling into the centre and stakes get higher.

programme.title: The Great Penguin Rescue S1 - "Episode 3"
programme.desc: Michaela rescues two cuddly little penguin chicks, but will she be able to care for them well enough to keep them alive through their critical first two weeks?

programme.title: Breakthrough S1 - "ECHO: The Penguin's Bodyguard"
programme.desc: In Antarctica, ECHO - a state-of-the-art robotic penguin - uses remote sensing technology to monitor these now-endangered penguin colonies.

programme.title: Borneo's Pygmy Elephants
programme.desc: Borneo’s diminutive pygmy forest elephants were always thought to be a feral population derived from domesticated Asian elephants. Now, though, DNA testing has confirmed that they are a unique subspecies who’ve lived on Borneo for at least 300,000 years.

programme.title: Wild About S1 - "Sharks"
programme.desc: Based on superstition and misconception, only intensive preservation efforts and increased public awareness may save them, but even then, some say it may be too late. Until that day Sharks will continue to stalk waters everywhere as one of the last remaining wild predators on earth.

programme.title: Wild About S1 - "Snakes"
programme.desc: With only a handful of snakes potentially dangerous to humans and most targeting rodents and pests, it seems their negative reputation today is unearned. Perhaps a product of their strange limb-less appearance, rather than their nature.

programme.title: Wild About S1 - "Raptors"
programme.desc: Many of the larger breeds of raptors are now endangered or vulnerable, particularly eagles, vultures and larger owls as they require large, specialized habitats. Though they may be soaring high now, the future doesn’t bode well for the great raptors.

programme.title: Wild About S1 - "Apes"
programme.desc: All great apes are highly endangered partly due to hunting and illegal pet trade, but mainly due to shrinking habitats. Sitting in the tree tops and jungles is a reminder of our past and our responsibilities for the future.

programme.title: Wild Animal Rescue S1 - "Closing the Worst Zoo In The World"
programme.sub-title: Closing the Worst Zoo In The World
programme.desc: Animals at a struggling zoo in Gaza are in desperate need of aid. Left devastated by war, Khan Younis Zoo was dubbed the ‘worst zoo in the world.’ In 2014 Khan Younis Zoo boasted 44 animals now only 15 remain. FOUR PAWS must rapidly swing into action

programme.title: Wild Animal Rescue S1 - "Sanctuary for Wildlife in the Middle East and the Rhino Crisis"
programme.sub-title: Sanctuary for Wildlife in the Middle East and the Rhino Crisis
programme.desc: Facing the constant threat of poaching, we meet the team who put their lives on the line to raise orphaned rhinos and return them to the wild; and in Jordan, we follow the high stakes mission to give rescued wild animals, an inspiring new home.

programme.title: Secret Wars Uncovered S1 - "Coups Detat"
programme.desc: An uncompromising show of power, the military coup is an age-old method to violently and often secretly topple governments and take control by force. This episode goes behind the scenes of some of the greatest coups in recent history.
